Features:
- Directors can select from companies they manage (if managing multiple)
- Owners can select from all companies in the system
- Company dropdown shown only when user has multiple companies
- Selected company persisted across page interactions

- Added SelectedCompanyId, AvailableCompanies, CanSelectCompany properties
- Updated OnGetAsync to:
  - Load available companies based on user role
  - Validate user has access to selected company
  - Use IgnoreQueryFilters for cross-company queries
  - Load users and shift types from selected company
- Updated OnPostAsync to set CompanyId on ShiftAssignment
- Updated all redirects to preserve selectedCompanyId parameter
- Added company selection dropdown to UI (auto-submits on change)
- Added hidden fields to preserve company selection in forms

- Owner: access to all companies
- Director: only companies they manage
- Manager: only their own company (no dropdown shown)

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Fix: Remove company selection from Assignments/Manage page

Problem:
- Company selection on Assignments page caused unexpected redirect
- Users could attempt cross-company assignments
- Company should be determined by shift type, not user selection

Solution:
- Removed company selection dropdown from Assignments/Manage UI
- Company now determined from ShiftType.CompanyId
- Added access validation: Owner/Director/Manager must have permission
- Added cross-company assignment prevention validation
- Users filtered to only show those from shift''s company
- Fixed redirect issue by loading shift type across all companies

Implementation:
- Removed SelectedCompanyId, AvailableCompanies, CanSelectCompany
- Load ShiftType with IgnoreQueryFilters to find across companies
- Validate user has access to shift''s company before showing page
- In OnPostAsync, validate selected user belongs to shift''s company
- Filter ActiveUsers and TimeOffRequests by shift''s CompanyId
- Removed all selectedCompanyId from redirects and forms

Validation:
- Owner: access to all company shifts
- Director: only shifts from companies they manage
- Manager: only shifts from their company
- Server-side validation blocks cross-company user assignments
- Clear error messages for unauthorized access and invalid assignments

This fixes the redirect issue and enforces proper company scoping.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add company selection to shift creation modal

Features:
- Owners see all companies in shift creation modal
- Directors see companies they manage (if multiple)
- Company dropdown shown only when user has access to multiple companies
- Shift types filtered by selected company
- Each shift type shows company name when multiple companies present

Implementation:
- Updated Day.cshtml.cs to:
  - Inject IDirectorService
  - Load shift types from all accessible companies using IgnoreQueryFilters
  - Add company info to ViewData for JavaScript
  - Include companyId and companyName in shift type data
- Updated Day.cshtml to pass companies array to JavaScript
- Updated site.js to:
  - Add company selector dropdown to shift creation modal
  - Filter shift types by selected company
  - Show company name on shift types when applicable
  - Auto-refresh shift types when company selection changes

User Experience:
- Owner: Dropdown shows all companies, can create shifts for any company
- Director (managing multiple): Dropdown shows managed companies
- Director (managing one): No dropdown, uses single company
- Manager/Employee: No dropdown, uses their company

This allows Owners and Directors to easily select which company
a shift belongs to during creation, eliminating the previous confusion.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
